country.name: Philippines
country.overview: The Philippines is a Southeast Asian country in the Western Pacific, comprising more than 7,000 islands. Its capital, Manila, is famous for its waterfront promenade and centuries-old Chinatown, Binondo. Intramuros, a walled city in colonial times, is the heart of Old Manila. It’s home to the baroque 17th-century San Agustin Church as well as Fort Santiago, a storied citadel and military prison.

translations.name: ປະເທດຟີລິບປິນ
ဖိလစ်ပိုင်နိုင်ငံ
ประเทศฟิลิปปินส์

geography.location_description: Southeastern Asia, archipelago between the Philippine Sea and the South China Sea, east of Vietnam
geography.area_note: slightly less than twice the size of Georgia; slightly larger than Arizona
geography.climate: tropical marine; northeast monsoon (November to April); southwest monsoon (May to October)
geography.terrain: mostly mountains with narrow to extensive coastal lowlands
geography.hazards: astride typhoon belt, usually affected by 15 and struck by five to six cyclonic storms each year; landslides; active volcanoes; destructive earthquakes; tsunamis
geography.notes: the Philippine archipelago is made up of 7,107 islands; favorably located in relation to many of Southeast Asia's main water bodies: the South China Sea, Philippine Sea, Sulu Sea, Celebes Sea, and Luzon Strait
